sect1.title: Authors
sect1.para: Authors in PMB correspond to statements of responsibility : hence a movie on video will have a director and not an author literally speaking. When adding a new bibliographical record, enter the author and his/her function in relation to the work.

sect2.title: Searching and editing authors
sect2.para: On the Authority > Authors screen, you can search an existing author, or add a new one. You can also add new information about an author, like his birthdate or death.
By default the Authority > Authors screen shows the results of a search on all authors.
You can also click on the link View recently added authors to display the last ten authors.

If an author has a pen name, you can add a SEE reference towards his/her real name. The same applies for a married woman, you may wish to add a SEE reference from her maiden name to her personal name.

sect3.title: Searching an author
sect3.para: To display an author entry, enter a part of his/her last name and click on Search. Select the corresponding name in the search results.
You can also select an author directly in the list of recently added authors, or in the default alphabetical list.

sect3.title: Editing an author
sect3.para: Various details can be entered for an author :

listitem.para: type : person or corporate body . A corporate body can be an association, a company...
Indexable name : a person's last name or a corporate body's name
non indexable name : the first name of a person
dates : birthdate and death for a person, creation and closure for a corporate body

retained form (See) : a cross-reference system between two authors. Click on the "..." button to open a pop-up and click on an author's name to create the reference. Click on the "X" button to clear a reference
web site : the person's web site or a closely related site (a biography, for instance), the corporate body's web site if any.

sect3.para: Delete allows the removal of an author. Caution: an author cannot be deleted if he or she is used in a bibliographical record.

The Used in button allows the identification of works in which the author is mentioned. It starts a search for the author in the catalogue tab. This allows you to know why the author cannot be deleted, for instance.
The Replace by ... button allows you to replace an author by another, so you can delete misspelt doubles, for instance.

sect3.title: Adding an author
sect3.para: Adding authors is similar to editing. For more information, consult the above section

sect2.title: Facilitate cataloguing : standardizing author's entry
sect2.para: Capitalize the first letter in the last and first name, enter the rest in lowercase.
The last name is the indexable element, the first name is the non indexable element.
For specific cases, if in doubt, leave the non indexable field empty.
For French names with prefixes (nobility), the "de", "des", "du" are entered in the non indexable field. If the prefix consists of an article (for example, La Fontaine) enter under the prefix.
Hyphenated names are entered in full.

For married women with compound names, make three entries : one under the compound name, another one under her maiden name and a last one under her given name; provide SEE references towards the name form indicated in the work.
Here are a few examples :

table.title: Examples of author entry : indexable element, non indexable element

row.entry: Bernard de La Barre de Nanteuil
La Barre de Nanteuil, Bernard de

sect2.para: Non indexable prefixed elements are placed after the comma (ex : La Fontaine, Jean de).

Names' prefixes are rejected in relation to the language used by or country of residence of the authors. Hence whether the preposition "de" in the last name is retained or not depends on the language or country of residence of the author. For more information consult your AACR2 (Anglo-American Cataloguing Rules 2)

table.title: Examples of names' prefixes treatment by language or country

row.entry: generally retained except for Spanish and Latin-American

sect2.title: Preamble
sect2.para: The PMB Subject Headings are not the Library of Congress Subject Headings : their choice should enable browsing from a hierarchy with a compact structure. The choice of the PMB developers is more of thematic classification like the UDC or Dewey hierarchy.

sect2.title: Browsing and modifying subject headings
sect2.para: Subject headings are used to classify works within the database and to help facilitate information retrieval by readers namely using the OPAC.
The object is to organize hierarchically under subject and sub-headings. PMB comes with a list of subject headings very useful for general documentation centres
If you are running a special library, you will have to adapt the subject headings to suit your needs, for instance, with your thesaurus.

Authority > Subjects
To browse the tree structure, click on the folders icons to open them. Clicking directly on a subject causes it to be selected and opens a screen allowing you to modify its contents.
You can specify various data for a subject :

listitem.para: the subject is mandatory
a comment can be added
if the subject is a sub-class, the field broader term enables you to select the main subject heading via the "..." button. To remove a selected broader term, click on the "X" button

the "See" reference allows you to create a cross-reference between two sub-classes having the same description, for instance, but located at two different positions in the tree structure. For example under Europe, the sub-heading France, and under NATO, the sub-heading France.

the "See also" reference allows you to enrich the subjects through the concept of association. For example, Rome can refer to the Roman way. Contrary to the "See" reference, the "See also" reference does not operate between identical terms.

sect2.para: Delete enables you to delete a subject. Caution a subject cannot be deleted if it is used in a record.
The Used in button enables you to identify the works classified under the subject. It starts a search by the subject in the cataloguing tab. This allows you to know why the subject cannot be deleted.
Comment : the Delete and Used in buttons are not visible when adding a new subject, but only when modifying it.

sect2.title: Searching and modifying a publisher
sect2.para: The Publishers and Authors screens follow the same logic.
To search for a publisher, enter your search term and click on Search. By default the screen displays all the publishers in the data base.
You can also click on the See recently added publishers link to display the last ten publishers added into the database.
Various data can be entered for a publisher :

listitem.para: the publisher's name
the address on two lines, the zip code, the city and country. Place of publication is an element often mentioned in bibliographical records. Whenever possible, indicate it for all publishers.
the publisher's web site

sect2.para: Delete enables you to delete a publisher. Caution a publisher cannot be deleted if it is used in a record.

The Used in button enables you to identify the works with the publisher's imprint. It starts a search for the publisher in the Cataloguing tab. This allows you to know why the publisher cannot be deleted.
The Replace with button allows you to replace a publisher with another, so you can delete misspelt doubles, for instance.
Comment : the Delete, Used in and Replace with buttons are not visible when adding a new publisher, but only when modifying it.

sect2.title: Facilitate cataloguing : standardizing publisher's entry
sect2.para: If the name bears a family name, kinship reference etc., delete the mentions relating to this kinship.
If an acronym is used, expand it.
Example OUP will be entered as Oxford University Press.

To facilitate the search, you can enter the acronym in brackets after the full name, however this is not in line with the AFNOR standard. In our example we will obtain : Oxford University Press (OUP).

sect1.title: Series
sect1.para: A series is a set of works authored by one or different persons, published by the same publisher under a collective title.
To display the last ten series titles added into the data base, click on the View recently added series link.
In PMB, you will always need to enter a publisher as authority when adding a new series.
Various data can be entered for a series :

listitem.para: the title of the series
an ISSN, if the series comes with an ISSN
a publisher must be entered for any series. To select a publisher, click on the "..." button and choose it in the pop-up. To delete a publisher already entered, click on the "X" button.

sect1.para: Delete allows you to delete a publisher. Caution a publisher cannot be deleted if it is used in a record.

The Used in button enables you to identify the works with the publisher's imprint. It starts a search for the publisher in the cataloguing tab. This allows you to know why the publisher cannot be deleted.
The Replace with button allows you to replace a publisher with another, so you can delete misspelt doubles, for instance.
Comment : the Delete, Used in and Replace with buttons are not visible when adding a new publisher, but only when modifying it.

sect1.title: Sub-series
sect1.para: A sub-series is a sub-division of a series.
From this screen you can search for a sub-series by entering a search expression and by clicking on Search.
You can also browse the sub-series. By default all the sub-series are displayed on this screen.
To display the last ten sub-series added to the database, click on the View recently added sub-series link
The displayed result first shows the sub-series title, then in brackets the series title and the publisher.
Various data can be entered for a sub-series :

listitem.para: the title of the sub-series
an ISSN, if the sub-series comes with an ISSN

for any sub-series, a series title (sub-series of...) must be specified. To select a series, click on the "..." button and choose it in the pop-up. To delete a series already entered, click on the "X" button.
A field is displayed showing the publisher of the series. But you cannot modify this field. If you want to change the publisher of a series, go through Authority > Series.

sect1.para: Delete allows you to delete a sub-series. Caution a sub-series cannot be deleted if it is used in a record.

The Used in button allows you to identify works published under the sub-series. This button starts a search for the sub-series in the cataloguing tab. It allows you to know why a sub-series cannot be deleted.
The Replace with button allows you to replace a sub-series with another, so you can delete misspelt doubles, for instance.
Comment : the Delete, Used in and Replace with buttons are not visible when adding a new sub-series, but only when modifying it.

sect1.title: Collections
sect1.para: A collection is a set of distinct works authored by the same person, for example The Adventures of Flash Gordon by Alex Raymond. For more information, consult Section 6 : Cataloguing, standardizing cataloguing.
To search for a collection, enter a search expression and click on Search. By default the screen displays all the collections in the base.
You can also click on the View recently added collections link to display the last ten collections added to the database.
Collections have only one editable field : title.
Delete allows you to delete a collection. Caution a collection cannot be deleted if it is used in a record.
The Replace with button allows you to replace a collection with another, so you can delete misspelt doubles, for instance.
Comment : the Delete and Replace with buttons are not visible when adding a new collections, but only when modifying it.

sect1.title: Classification
sect1.para: PMB integrates decimal classifications allowing you to personalize the indexing of your library collection. For more information about PMB decimal classifications, read the chapter PMB pre-installed thesauri and classification schemes.

To look up a class number, enter a search expression and click on Search. By default the screen displays all the class numbers in the database. This search is carried out on both the class number (110) and its subject description (Metaphysics)
You can also click on View recently added class numbers link to display the last ten class numbers added in the database.

figure.title: Authority > Class numbers, modifying a class number

sect1.para: You can define the following for a class number :

listitem.para: a notation (mandatory)
a description

sect1.para: Delete allows you to remove a class number. Caution a class number cannot be deleted if it is used in a record.

The Used in button allows you to identify all works with the same class numbers. This button starts a search for the class number in the cataloguing tab. It allows you to know why a class number cannot be deleted.
The Replace with button allows you to replace a class number with another one.
Note : the Delete, Used in and Replace with buttons are not visible when adding a new class number, but only when modifying it.
